name: (3beta,4alpha,8alpha,17xi,20xi)-4,14-dimethyl-8,9-epoxycholestan-3-ol
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1934
Reason: 4,14-dimethyl-8,9-epoxycholestan-3-ol is a derivative of cholestanol, which has a melting point around 148-150°C. The presence of the epoxide group (–O) in the 8,9-position increases the molecular weight and size, which generally raises the melting point. However, the epoxide group can also participate in hydrogen bonding, which can lower the melting point. Taking the effect of the epoxide group into consideration, we can predict a net increase due to molecular size but a more significant decrease due to additional hydrogen bonding. The net effect should thus be a slightly increased melting point compared to cholestanol.
